<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/leaders-warning-of-climate-disaster-take-a-mad-max-tone-at-cop26?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Leaders Channel 'Mad Max' at COP26
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/leaders-warning-of-climate-disaster-take-a-mad-max-tone-at-cop26?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Boris Johnson" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/f93892d6bcf66a9e844a2c8eace34978eda3d872-1024x683.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>ALBERTO PEZZALI/POOL/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At the COP26 climate conference, world leaders <a href="https://apnews.com/article/climate-g-20-summit-joe-biden-science-business-da0fe0135f37a9c0f78593051f06bedf?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a> that inaction on climate wouldn’t just invite more hurricanes than we can name—it could literally <a href="https://apnews.com/article/climate-g-20-summit-joe-biden-science-business-da0fe0135f37a9c0f78593051f06bedf?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">topple governments</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, the host of the negotiations, said in a speech that people’s anger would be “uncontainable” if leaders didn’t tackle the problem. A few days ago, Johnson <a href="https://www.newstatesman.com/environment/cop26/2021/10/boris-johnson-likens-climate-change-to-the-decline-and-fall-of-the-roman-empire?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">compared</a> the climate threat to “the decline and fall of the Roman empire.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Hot temps = hotter tempers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Governments, especially in Europe, are concerned that the challenges of transitioning to a greener economy could spark a <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/01/business/energy-environment/europe-climate-action-cost.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">populist uprising</a> of citizens, the NYT reports.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">For an example, look at what’s happening in European energy markets:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As countries like the UK have </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-u-k-ditched-coal-and-left-itself-with-a-new-set-of-challenges-11635073201?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">phased out coal</a></span><span> in a shift to renewables, they’ve become dependent on natural gas—but that has skyrocketed in price this fall.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Spanish demonstrators took to the streets in September to protest spiraling electricity bills, leading the government to cap energy companies’ profits and help out households.</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It’s not all about rich countries</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Lower-income nations that face the more immediate threats of climate change—like rising sea levels and extreme heat—could become <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/national-security/climate-change-threatens-spark-instability-conflict-around-world-u-s-n1282078?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major sources of geopolitical instability</a>, according to reports from the White House, the Pentagon, and US intelligence agencies last month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This is a major change in thinking because up until now, the US military has mainly viewed climate change in terms of, “Let’s make sure we’re prepared for terrible weather.” The new approach is more like, “Climate change could spark wars, mass migration, and competition for dwindling resources that threaten global security.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>doomsday predictions make great headlines, but they don’t solve any problems. World leaders will depart the COP26 today after wrapping up their speeches, leaving other government officials to nail down the details of actual policies.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One of those policies: </strong>India, the world’s third-largest emitter, said it would <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-01/india-will-reach-net-zero-emissions-by-2070-modi-tells-cop26?srnd=premium" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reach net-zero emissions</a> by 2070 in a surprise announcement.</p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD AND BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/coca-cola-makes-it-s-most-expensive-brand-acquisition-in-history-buying-bodyarmor?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Coke Says Later, Gatorade
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/coca-cola-makes-it-s-most-expensive-brand-acquisition-in-history-buying-bodyarmor?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Dumbell with Coke cans as weights" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/7cf2e56620ba069558ad98e4023985eda5335a36-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><em>Francis Scialabba</em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coca-Cola made its biggest push yet to dethrone Pepsi’s Gatorade as the sports drink king. The beverage giant agreed to <a href="https://qz.com/2082638/coca-cola-is-buying-bodyarmor-to-compete-with-pepsis-gatorade/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">buy the rest of BodyArmor</a> for $5.6 billion. BodyArmor is valued at $8 billion. Expensive juice—so expensive that it’s Coke’s biggest brand acquisition in its history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s BodyArmor?</strong> Founded in 2011 as a “natural alternative” to sugary sports drinks, the brand sold a 15% stake to Coke in 2018. Naomi Osaka and the late Kobe Bryant both backed it, and the brand signed a multiyear deal with MLS in 2019.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>When combined with its Powerade product’s reach, the BodyArmor deal would give Coke a 22% share of the US sports drink market.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Still, Gatorade owns about 70% of that market. A huge chunk can be credited to Blue Frost’s hangover-healing powers. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Since he became Coke’s CEO in 2017, James Quincey set a path to become a “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/cokes-new-ceo-james-quincey-to-staff-make-mistakes-1494356502?mod=article_inline" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">total beverage company.</a>” Coke bought sparkling water brand Topo Chico in 2017, scooped up Costa Coffee in 2019, and took a stab at being milk guys when it bought lactose-free dairy brand Fairlife last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fun fact: </strong>Kobe nabbed a 10% stake in BodyArmor in 2014, investing $6 million over time. His family will reportedly <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coke-to-pay-5-6-billion-for-full-control-of-bodyarmor-11635713140?mod=mktw&mod=article_inline&adobe_mc=MCMID=91891864179419586721643737078586507798%7CMCORGID=CB68E4BA55144CAA0A4C98A5%40AdobeOrg%7CTS=1635780325" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">collect ~$400 million</a> from the sale—that’s more than Kobe made during his entire basketball career.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
COVID
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/disneyland-shanghai-shut-down-after-one-reported-case?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's a Pandemic, After All
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/disneyland-shanghai-shut-down-after-one-reported-case?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Shanghai Disneyland " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a8caf448abc9a0e93543fe106477c8c5aa82fa1b-1024x655.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tang Yanjun/China News Service via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, Shanghai Disneyland <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-59119621?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closed</a> for at least two days when a single weekend attendee tested positive for Covid after returning home.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a bizarre scene, nearly 34,000 guests at the theme park on Sunday <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/shanghai-disneyland-suspends-operations-as-visitors-queue-for-covid-19-tests-before-exiting-11635755117?mod=hp_lead_pos10" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lined up</a> to get tested by people in hazmat suits before being forced to leave, even as Disney’s famous fireworks display rumbled around them.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I never thought that the longest queue in Disneyland would be for a nucleic acid test,” one guest posted to social media.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>China continues to pursue a strategy of <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/11/01/china/china-covid-extreme-measures-mic-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shutting down society</a> when any hint of a Covid outbreak appears.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two trains were stopped literally in their tracks last week when a couple of crew members were discovered to have been in close contact with people who were infected.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And after finding one positive case Saturday, one county in Jiangxi province turned all of its traffic lights red to discourage people from driving.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>China’s “zero Covid” policy is increasingly at odds with how other countries are approaching Covid containment. Even lockdown-happy nations like Australia and New Zealand have abandoned their zero Covid strategy, arguing that the highly contagious Delta variant made it unworkable.</p>
</div>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TOGETHER WITH THE MOTLEY FOOL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
POV: You’re a Stock That’s Hedged Against Inflation
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.fool.com/ext-content/inflation-is-here-learn-to-protect-yourself-with-2/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=inflation-rising&aid=9561&paid=9561&waid=9561&source=esamnbwdg0500021&psource=esamnbwdg0500021&wsource=esamnbwdg0500021&testId=a-sa-inflation&cellId=0&campaign=sa-inflation" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="The Motley Fool" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://media2.morningbrew.com/uploads/placement/images/2179/1634928787-People-237.jpg">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Unfortunately, inflation is here. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While that means bad things for your wallet when it comes to groceries and gas, it’s possible you can still smile when looking at your investments if you protect yourself with <a href="https://www.fool.com/ext-content/inflation-is-here-learn-to-protect-yourself-with-2/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=inflation-rising&aid=9561&paid=9561&waid=9561&source=esamnbwdg0500021&psource=esamnbwdg0500021&wsource=esamnbwdg0500021&testId=a-sa-inflation&cellId=0&campaign=sa-inflation" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this stock pick from The Motley Fool</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Traditionally, investors have identified gold as a solid pizza oven in which to park your dough during periods of high inflation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The thing is, gold value <em>barely </em>outpaced the inflation rate this century—which is why <strong style="color:#000">The Motley Fool has identified four stocks which could flourish despite inflation</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Turn that frown upside down and <a href="https://www.fool.com/ext-content/inflation-is-here-learn-to-protect-yourself-with-2/?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=inflation-rising&aid=9561&paid=9561&waid=9561&source=esamnbwdg0500021&psource=esamnbwdg0500021&wsource=esamnbwdg0500021&testId=a-sa-inflation&cellId=0&campaign=sa-inflation" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">peep the stock picks here</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/key-performance-indicators-november-2?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/key-performance-indicators-november-2?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A house in a frozen block of ice " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/927c2d0f2655659e9deac0cc94a8464d1c8508cf-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/zillow-stock-dives-after-analyst-highlights-two-thirds-of-homes-bought-are-underwater-11635785293?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Two-thirds</a> of the homes Zillow purchased with the intent of flipping are listed below their purchase price, according to an analyst’s note. Now, after announcing a pause on home buying for 2021, the company is reportedly selling <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-01/zillow-selling-7-000-homes-for-2-8-billion-after-flipping-halt?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">7,000 homes</a> for around $2.8 billion.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “Instead of tweets, allow me to show you. We can meet anywhere—Earth or space...”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The head of the UN’s World Food Programme (WFP), David Beasley, is <a href="https://twitter.com/WFPChief/status/1455191851829497861?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ready for blastoff</a>. This was his response to Elon Musk, who wrote that if the WFP could describe how $6 billion would solve world hunger in a Twitter thread, he would “sell Tesla stock right now and do it.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The most comprehensive and compelling report of the January 6 attack on the Capitol yet. (<a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/interactive/2021/warnings-jan-6-insurrection/?pwapi_token=eyJ0eXAiOiJKV1QiLCJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9..I1EDkxu1UpH0T--FuJsBbwn056p3Qvw1IjXki3fTm-M&itid=gfta&utm_medium=email&utm_source=nextdraft" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Washington Post</a>)</p>
</div>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/the-squid-game-cryptocurrency-scam?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Red Light on Memecoins
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/11/01/the-squid-game-cryptocurrency-scam?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='A killer robot from the Netflix show Squid Game playing the game "Red Light Green Light"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a2c30458475dfb351b37c1308f0113154213cb27-900x600.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Netflix</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The <em>Squid Game</em> cryptocurrency has a winner, and it’s not your favorite character. After the token jumped 310,000% in less than two weeks, its anonymous creators have liquidated their shares, making off with an <a href="https://gizmodo.com/squid-game-cryptocurrency-scammers-make-off-with-2-1-m-1847972824?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">estimated $2.1 million</a> in an apparent scam.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The cryptocurrency, called SQUID, was worth $0.012 last Tuesday. By Friday, the coin had skyrocketed in price and was widely covered in the media for its huge gains and (unofficial) tie to the wildly popular Netflix series. The token’s value peaked Sunday night at $2,861.80 before dropping 100% as of Monday to around half a cent.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">SQUID popped onto the scene on October 20, purporting to be a pay-to-earn currency for an upcoming online game based on <em>Squid Game</em>. But, as Gizmodo points out, there were several red flags:</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/triangular-flag-on-post_1f6a9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> The coin’s website was filled with spelling and grammatical errors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/triangular-flag-on-post_1f6a9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> The Twitter account didn’t allow replies to posts.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/triangular-flag-on-post_1f6a9.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""> Investors were unable to sell their coins.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why take the risk? </strong>Have you watched the show? <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/shiba-inu-s-epic-rally-unseats-dogecoin-puts-robinhood-on-notice?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Memecoins</a> like dogecoin and shiba inu that went parabolic have made millionaires of early investors. But the SQUID episode shows how these speculative investments can fall just as hard.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etopple governments\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, the host of the negotiations, said in a speech that people’s anger would be “uncontainable” if leaders didn’t tackle the problem. A few days ago, Johnson \u003ca href=\"https://www.newstatesman.com/environment/cop26/2021/10/boris-johnson-likens-climate-change-to-the-decline-and-fall-of-the-roman-empire?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecompared\u003c/a\u003e the climate threat to “the decline and fall of the Roman empire.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHot temps = hotter tempers\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eGovernments, especially in Europe, are concerned that the challenges of transitioning to a greener economy could spark a \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/11/01/business/energy-environment/europe-climate-action-cost.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epopulist uprising\u003c/a\u003e of citizens, the NYT reports.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFor an example, look at what’s happening in European energy markets:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs countries like the UK have \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-u-k-ditched-coal-and-left-itself-with-a-new-set-of-challenges-11635073201?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ephased out coal\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e in a shift to renewables, they’ve become dependent on natural gas—but that has skyrocketed in price this fall.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSpanish demonstrators took to the streets in September to protest spiraling electricity bills, leading the government to cap energy companies’ profits and help out households.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt’s not all about rich countries\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLower-income nations that face the more immediate threats of climate change—like rising sea levels and extreme heat—could become \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/national-security/climate-change-threatens-spark-instability-conflict-around-world-u-s-n1282078?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor sources of geopolitical instability\u003c/a\u003e, according to reports from the White House, the Pentagon, and US intelligence agencies last month.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis is a major change in thinking because up until now, the US military has mainly viewed climate change in terms of, “Let’s make sure we’re prepared for terrible weather.” The new approach is more like, “Climate change could spark wars, mass migration, and competition for dwindling resources that threaten global security.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003edoomsday predictions make great headlines, but they don’t solve any problems. World leaders will depart the COP26 today after wrapping up their speeches, leaving other government officials to nail down the details of actual policies.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne of those policies: \u003c/strong\u003eIndia, the world’s third-largest emitter, said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-01/india-will-reach-net-zero-emissions-by-2070-modi-tells-cop26?srnd=premium\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereach net-zero emissions\u003c/a\u003e by 2070 in a surprise announcement.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS to dethrone Pepsi’s Gatorade as the sports drink king. The beverage giant agreed to \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/2082638/coca-cola-is-buying-bodyarmor-to-compete-with-pepsis-gatorade/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebuy the rest of BodyArmor\u003c/a\u003e  for $5.6 billion. BodyArmor is valued at $8 billion. Expensive juice—so expensive that it’s Coke’s biggest brand acquisition in its history.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s BodyArmor?\u003c/strong\u003e Founded in 2011 as a “natural alternative” to sugary sports drinks, the brand sold a 15% stake to Coke in 2018. Naomi Osaka and the late Kobe Bryant both backed it, and the brand signed a multiyear deal with MLS in 2019.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWhen combined with its Powerade product’s reach, the BodyArmor deal would give Coke a 22% share of the US sports drink market.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eStill, Gatorade owns about 70% of that market. A huge chunk can be credited to Blue Frost’s hangover-healing powers. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e Since he became Coke’s CEO in 2017, James Quincey set a path to become a “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/cokes-new-ceo-james-quincey-to-staff-make-mistakes-1494356502?mod=article_inline\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etotal beverage company.\u003c/a\u003e” Coke bought sparkling water brand Topo Chico in 2017, scooped up Costa Coffee in 2019, and took a stab at being milk guys when it bought lactose-free dairy brand Fairlife last year. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFun fact: \u003c/strong\u003eKobe nabbed a 10% stake in BodyArmor in 2014, investing $6 million over time. His family will reportedly \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coke-to-pay-5-6-billion-for-full-control-of-bodyarmor-11635713140?mod=mktw\u0026mod=article_inline\u0026adobe_mc=MCMID=91891864179419586721643737078586507798%7CMCORGID=CB68E4BA55144CAA0A4C98A5%40AdobeOrg%7CTS=1635780325\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecollect ~$400 million\u003c/a\u003e from the sale—that’s more than Kobe made during his collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, Shanghai Disneyland \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-china-59119621?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclosed\u003c/a\u003e for at least two days when a single weekend attendee tested positive for Covid after returning home.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a bizarre scene, nearly 34,000 guests at the theme park on Sunday \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/shanghai-disneyland-suspends-operations-as-visitors-queue-for-covid-19-tests-before-exiting-11635755117?mod=hp_lead_pos10\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elined up\u003c/a\u003e to get tested by people in hazmat suits before being forced to leave, even as Disney’s famous fireworks display rumbled around them.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“I never thought that the longest queue in Disneyland would be for a nucleic acid test,” one guest posted to social media.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eChina continues to pursue a strategy of \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/11/01/china/china-covid-extreme-measures-mic-intl-hnk/index.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshutting down society\u003c/a\u003e when any hint of a Covid outbreak appears.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo trains were stopped literally in their tracks last week when a couple of crew members were discovered to have been in close contact with people who were infected.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd after finding one positive case Saturday, one county in Jiangxi province turned all of its traffic lights red to discourage people from driving.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eChina’s “zero Covid” policy is increasingly at odds with how other countries are approaching Covid containment. Even lockdown-happy nations like Australia and New Zealand have abandoned their zero Covid strategy, arguing that the highly contagious Delta variant made it unworkable.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt='A killer robot from the Netflix show Squid Game playing the game \"Red Light Green Light\"' src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/a2c30458475dfb351b37c1308f0113154213cb27-900x600.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eNetflix\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe \u003cem\u003eSquid Game\u003c/em\u003e cryptocurrency has a winner, and it’s not your favorite character. After the token jumped 310,000% in less than two weeks, its anonymous creators have liquidated their shares, making off with an \u003ca href=\"https://gizmodo.com/squid-game-cryptocurrency-scammers-make-off-with-2-1-m-1847972824?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eestimated $2.1 million\u003c/a\u003e in an apparent scam.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe cryptocurrency, called SQUID, was worth $0.012 last Tuesday. By Friday, the coin had skyrocketed in price and was widely covered in the media for its huge gains and (unofficial) tie to the wildly popular Netflix series. The token’s value peaked Sunday night at $2,861.80 before dropping 100% as of Monday to around half a cent.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSQUID popped onto the scene on October 20, purporting to be a pay-to-earn currency for an upcoming online game based on \u003cem\u003eSquid Game\u003c/em\u003e. But, as Gizmodo points out, there were several red flags:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/triangular-flag-on-post_1f6a9.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e The coin’s website was filled with spelling and grammatical errors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/triangular-flag-on-post_1f6a9.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e The Twitter account didn’t allow replies to posts.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/triangular-flag-on-post_1f6a9.png\" width=\"18\" style=\"max-width:18px\" alt=\"\"\u003e Investors were unable to sell their coins.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy take the risk? \u003c/strong\u003eHave you watched the show? \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/27/shiba-inu-s-epic-rally-unseats-dogecoin-puts-robinhood-on-notice?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eMemecoins\u003c/a\u003e like dogecoin and shiba inu that went parabolic have made millionaires of early investors. But the SQUID episode shows how these speculative investments can fall just as hard.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
